sentences.sContent: This raises doubts about the point of advertising.
sentences.sCn: 这引起了人们对于广告作用的怀疑。

sentences.sContent: There is little doubt that man has had an impact on the Earth's climate.
sentences.sCn: 毫无疑问人类对地球上的气候造成了影响。

phrases.pCn: 假定其无过失或无罪（因无充分证据证明某人有罪）；裁判员对可疑情况无把握时不对有关运动员作不利判定
引起对…的怀疑；对…产生怀疑
辣手摧花（电影名称，又名心声疑影）

words.tran: 可疑的；令人生疑的；疑心的；不能确定的
无疑地；确定地；大概，多半
抱怀疑态度的人；不信宗教的人；怀疑论者

remMethod.val: 双重(double)身份， 值得怀疑(doubt)

trans.tranOther: If you have doubt or doubts about something, you feel uncertain about it and do not know whether it is true or possible. If you say you have no doubt about it, you mean that you are certain it is true.
to think that something may not be true or that it is unlikely
